channel.title: Projects on Jimmie West
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Jimmie West

item.title: Fatal Friction
item.description: A game about taking control over a ball and mastering friction to avoid a fatal outcome. The game was created in order to drive the development of the Pixleon Engine. Another important aspect of developing this game was to actually finish a game. Sounds easy but as it turns out, it is quite hard. So would I consider the game finished? Not really, but it is playable and I aim to iterate on it until I can proudly present a 1.

item.title: Pixleon Engine
item.description: The Pixleon Engine is a game engine written in C++ with focus on 3D-games with physics. The main motivation behind building it was to learn more about software development and game engine development in particular. For instance, I wanted to answer: How to decopuple different parts of a game engine? How to organize code into proper folders to help maintain decoupling? How to produce an interface from dlls that can be re-used in different games or interactive experiences?
